Today, I will vote in favor of the National Apprenticeship Act of 2021 which would invest more than $3.5 billion to create nearly 1 million new apprenticeship opportunities over the next five years. The proposal expands apprenticeship opportunities by:

- Making it easier for workers and employers to participate in high-quality apprenticeships by codifying and streamlining standards for Registered Apprenticeship, youth apprenticeship and pre-apprenticeship programs.

- Expanding apprenticeships into new occupations and sectors by directing the Department of Labor‚Äôs Office of Apprenticeship to convene industry leaders, labor organizations, educators, and others to reach a more diverse set of workers and employers.

- Increasing funding for apprenticeships through a $400 million grant program to support the expansion of apprenticeship opportunities, including pre-apprenticeships and youth apprenticeships, which will increase $100 million annually to reach $800 million by 2026.
